page.title: 06Clubs - Stonehouse Gang
page.content: The Stonehouse Gang was formed by Harry Webb in 1938. He was a reporter & saw boys getting into trouble in court so e started a club. He called it Stonehouse Gang after the name of our estate. It had a motto "It is better to light a candle than cure the darkness". It began in a church but moved to Swinford Rd & used an old hen-house as a building. Rules were made & a court was held to pass sentence on members who misbehaved. In 1965 a cottage in Wales was bought by a rich man as a gift to the gang. It is called Ty-Careg which means Stonehouse in Welsh. This information was given to us by Mike Lee who is the present leader. I think the gang is great on Tuesday night. We play games & do disco dancing & I have made a lot of friends & been to Wales for a week-end. 69 children in our school are members of the Gang.
